head.supplied: ¶ [new species] ¶ ¶ [new species, so many sterile fragments] ¶ ¶ [scarcely detemin.] ¶ ¶ [(not J. G. Agardh)] ¶ ¶ [(subtropical New Holland)]. ...

div.p: RB MSS M108a, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.

MS undated, but probably posted in February 1886 since the three sheets are annotated by M 'Received 2/4/86'. 1) Algae from New Zealand, near Auckland J. M. Fedarb
J. W. Fedarb?
1885 . (arrived to Lund Dec. 1885)
2.) Algae from New Zealand (in a separate parcel)

Delesseria (Hemineura) undulatissima J. Ag. nov. sp.
Not in Algaebase under this name (accessed 9 March 2021); but Agardh (1894-1903, continuato 2, p. 66, described D. undulatum based on a Harvey specimen collected at King George Sound, WA.
Myriocladia (?) laetevirens nov. sp. ad tantum fragmenta sterilia

4. Algae from Geograph Bay ( Busselton )
WA.
A. M. Pries . 1885 .
Sargassum parvifolium Turn? (non J. G. Ag.)

5. Algae from Hervey bay .
Qld. ( Nov. Holl. subtropicae ) ( arrived to Lund Jan. 1886. )

Halyseris Acrostichoides
Haliseris acrostichoides? J. Ag.
Sargassorum fragmenta varia (vix determinanda specimine nisi fructifera!)
[Various fragments of Sargassums (scarcely determinable if specimens not fruiting!)]

6. Algae from the mouth of Bloomfield River
Qld.
Miss Bauer
Miss Ellie Bauer.
1885 .

7 Algae from Port Jackson: Camara .
Chevalier A. Camara; see A. Camara to M, 5 June 1881.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

div.p: Cladophora sp. minuta — habitu ad Cl. Echinus.

8) Algae from Arnhems land N. W. Australia
NT.
1885 . M. Holze .
i.e. Holtze.

9) Algae from Rivoli Bay (Nov. Holl. austr. )
SA.
Mrs Wehl .
M's sister, Clara Wehl.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;
font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

div.p:
10.) Algae from East of King Georges Sound
WA.
1884 .

11.) Algae from Frasers Island ( Tropical East Austr .).
Qld.
Caulerpa sp. near to C. Taxifolia
